title: 8 Easy Steps to Add a Webcam to OBS on PC or Mac

steps.title: Connect the webcam to your PC or Mac.
steps.content: Connect the webcam to your PC or Mac. If you haven’t yet set up your webcam, see Set up a Webcam now.

steps.title: Open OBS Studio.
steps.content: Open OBS Studio. It’s in the All Apps area of the Start menu in Windows, and the Applications folder in macOS.

steps.title: Click + under “Sources.”
steps.content: Click + under “Sources.” It’s the first icon at the bottom of the “Sources” box. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Video Capture Device.
steps.content: Click Video Capture Device . It’s near the bottom of the menu. This opens the “Create/Select Source” window.

steps.title: Type a name for the webcam.
steps.content: Type a name for the webcam. It goes into the “Create New” box at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . The Properties menu will appear.

steps.title: Select your webcam from the “Device” drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select your webcam from the “Device” drop-down menu. It’s the first menu in the window.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It’s at the bottom of the window. Your webcam is now added to OBS Studio.
